MifareClassicTool (MCT)

• Version: %1$s
• License: GPLv3
• Project Page: MCT on github
• Rate this app: via Google Play
• Donate: via my webpage where is a paypal link

Useful information:
• Bug Tracker
• Changelog / Version History
• Documentation, APKs, etc.
• Thread at the Proxmark forum

If the tag gets lost during the key mapping process (due to antenna issues, timeout, etc.), the app will try to reconnect to it (with a delay of 500ms) until one attempt succeeds. 

This may help if you encounter issues during the key mapping process. However, it might also cause MCT to behave strangely. 

Known issues where this setting may help:
 • Special tags (e.g. smartMX)

Writing to the first block of sector 0 is not possible on original Mifare Classic tags. 

Please make sure you are using a special tag that supports writing to the manufacturer block (with a normal Mifare Classic write command). 

Check out the "Write Tag" section from "Help and Info" for more information.

This mode allows your android device to bruteforce any nfc tag, but it can take soo long. There are two modes, a single thread that goes from what you want to FFFFFFFFFFFF and the double one that allows you to choose the start value and the last one.
Force a custom sector count and ignore the sector count detected by Android. This can be useful for tags with 2K memory.

The tag was manufacured between %1$s and %2$s

(This information might be wrong. See \"Help and Info\" for more information.)

The date of manufacture contains invalid data. 

The last 2 bytes of the manufacturer block should be in binary coded decimal format (only digits, no letters). The first byte (week of manufacture) must be between 1 and 53 (e.g. 28). The second byte (year of manufacture) must be between 0 and the current year (e.g. 12, meaning 2012). 

Maybe the tag is not an original Mifare Classic tag.

This is a MCT apk Mod \n\nThere is a lot of new feautures, that requires your agreement of this terms: -You are completely responsable of your acts -I\'m not responsible of any damage or act you do. -You have to use this app on cards that are completely yours. By continue using this app, it means you accept this terms and conditions.

This activity will allow you to see the information of a NFC credit card and automatically emulate it. Once you have read the credit card, you can save that info and check it out whenever you want in the list menu.Check out modder info in the main menu to see the original project.

This application is dedicated to users who have at least basic familiarity with the Mifare Classic technology. Its features are basic and at a low level. Therefore nearly all data input and output will be hexadecimal. It is also important that you understand what you are doing, e.g. if you write data to a tag. Writing the wrong data to certain blocks may cause irreparable damage to the tag. \n\nFOR MORE INFORMATION AND HELP CHECK OUT THE \"Help and Info\" SECTION.

The first block of the first sector of an MIFARE Classic tag contains the UID and is read-only i.e. not writable. But there are special MIFARE Classic tags (\"magic tags 2nd gen\", aka. \"block 0 direct write tags\") that support writing to the first block (including the UID) with a simple write command. This App is able to write to such tags and can therefore clone the UID. However, some special tags (\"magic tags 1st gen\") require a special command sequence to put them into the state where writing to the manufacturer block is possible. These tags will not work. \n\nFor now this tool will only work with 4-byte UIDs.
To write to block 0 (the block with the UID) you need the corresponding key with write privileges. For blank or factory formatted tags this key is key A with a value of \"FFFFFFFFFFFF\".
Choose the sector range for the key mapping process\n(0 is the first sector):
Enter a file name for the new file:
The NFC adapter is not enabled. Please go to your Settings and enable it.

Your device (due to hardware) does not support Mifare Classic! The only thing possible is to display the UID and some other generic information. Further I/O operations are impossible.

Therefore, this app is pretty much useless for this device.

You can view a list of known devices with no Mifare Classic support at github. If your device is not on that list, please write an Email to developer.

This tag is not compatible with the Mifare Classic technology! Notice that this app is designed for Mifare Classic tags only!

Please use another tag.

(Notice: In some rare cases this message could be a false positive caused by multiple tags in the reader field or strange ATQA+SAK values.)
No NFC hardware was found on your device. You need an NFC enabled device in order to run this app properly.
Some parts are not writable! Check the WHOLE list below.

MIFARE Classic tags can typically only be written blockwise. The UID is represented by the first bytes of block 0. To change the UID, the full block 0 must be written. The \"rest of block 0\" data are the bytes which will get appended to the UID to represent a full block.

Retry the authentication (to access a sector/block) X times if it fails.

Some tags need this in order to work well (e.g. some block 0 writable tags with 7 bytes UID). Also, might help to get some devices to work more consistent (e.g. the Google Nexus 5X or the Huawei P10).

Keep in mind that this might slow down reading, writing or even key mapping. In most cases you should leave this option disabled.
There are unsaved changes! \nDo you want to save these changes?
This file already exists. What do you want to do? Note: Files containing multiple dumps (created by using \"append\") can not be displayed, edited or written by this app.
This file already exists. What do you want to do?
Enter a file name for the dump:
Enter a file name for the key file:
You\'re about to write to a sector trailer. Writing incorrect data may cause irreparable damage to the tag.

Replace all Access Conditions from the dump with the chosen ones. 

This is useful if the dump contains Access Conditions that will be permanent for a tag. In case the reader does not check them, you can easily use custom ones to make the tag reusable. 

WARNING: Writing incorrect data may cause irreparable damage to the tag.

This mode will allow you to read tags while screen is off and also it will repeat the key dictionary the times you want ,until its read something or you press stop stealth mode. (It may have some errors, you can\'t put more than15 times because you may break the app). Now is only available a repetitive mode while the screen is on, the service, that will provide lock screen reading, is under testing and has a lot of issues, thats why is not available yet.(Hopefully a new version of this app will bring the stealth mode as a Beta or even as a release version)

Android commonly has two places to store files: The internal and the external memory.

The internal memory is only readable by the app and will be deleted once the app gets uninstalled.

The external storage, in many cases the SD card, is readable by every app with sufficient rights. Data stored on the external memory will survive an uninstall of the app.

By using this option you can switch between the two storages. Dump and key files will not be copied between them.
Select the sectors you want to write:
Put your card behind your phone and I\'ll try to read it.
New Card Here as: "XX, XX, XX, XX" Example: 12, 34, 56, 78
Card detected but it is not a supported Credit Card

Error: Access Conditions have to be 3 bytes (6 characters) long

Key B is readable. \nACs of data blocks have been updated.
Error: Addr is not a hex byte (0-9, A-F, 2 characters)
Error: There is no manufacturer block (block 0)

Error: Block or sector is not specified
Error: Data was not correct for this editor
Error: Files must have a name
Error: Block is read-only or not writable with keys from key file

Error: File is too big (out of memory)
Error: Lost connection to the tag
Error in mapping range: Sector out of range. Use a bigger tag.
There are no dumps. Read a tag and save the dump
Error: External storage is not readable/writable

Error: Data must be 16 bytes (32 characters) long

This function is not supported in this version. (Maybe it will come in future versions…)
Error: Selected block is not a Value Block
There is nothing left to write
Error: The length of the rest of block 0 is incorrect
Error: Retries must be between 1 and 1000
Error: Sector count must be between 1 and 40
Error: The sector is out of range
Error: A strange error occurred… and I don\'t know why :(\nPlease report this using the project page
Error: Tag is too small for the chosen dump
Error: Too many keys (out of memory)
Error: Multiple times the same sector number
Error: Some blocks don\'t have 16 bytes (32 characters)
Error: Some sectors don\'t have 4 or 16 blocks (lines)
Error: Some block(s) contain invalid data (not hex)
Error: Sector out of range (< 0 or > 39)
Error: There must be at least one key
Error: Some keys don\'t have 6 bytes (12 characters)
Error: Some key(s) contain invalid data (not hex)
Error: The value is too big
Error: Some error occurred while writing.\nThis could be really bad.

This activity will allow you to emulate any NFC UID by typing it or just scanning the tag. Check out modder info in the main menu to see the original project.
Error, put less than 15 times or check Advanced mode
MIFARE DESFire or \nMIFARE DESFire EV1, NXP
MIFARE DESFire or \nMIFARE DESFire EV1, NXP
Error: This configuration is not known
Choose the dump to be written:
Error: Are you sure you have a magic tag (2nd gen)?
This tool can clone the UID of a tag to a \"magic tag\" (2nd gen, Android compatible, direct write, block 0 writable). Hit the info button to get more information.
Try to format the tag to factory/delivery state.
Increment or decrement and than transfer a Value Block. (If you don\'t know what Value Blocks are, check out \"Help and Info\".)
Invalid Access Conditions or dead sector :(
This device does not support Mifare Classic!
There is no Mifare Classic tag.
Open or Create a Key File
Step 1: Choose ACs for Sector Trailer
Step 2: Choose ACs for Data Blocks
\"Tag Type and Manufacturer\" might be wrong.\nSee \"Help and Info\" for more information.
Write a dump (or some sectors of it) to a tag. Blocks containing unknown data (---) will be skipped!

Key with write access (B) not known

This activity will allow you to see the information of a mifare ultralight tag. Once you have read it, you can save that info and check it out whenever you want in the list menu.Check out modder info in the main menu to see the original project.(in a future update emulate ultralight will be added)(.mut files are "mifare ultralight tags", which is just a txt)
